general_comment:
You did a good job here, congratulations! :clap:
 
Just a few things that are always good to keep in mind:
- Always, **always** [clean up your project](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eYvuXY7GRE6VQpq4Rp-KotU1ti-JEySN1KdyKwjhzEQ/pub?embedded=true) and also add some files to gitignore (if you are using Git :octocat:, of course). This way your configurations and private data won't be shared. Read this discussion about it on [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16736856/what-should-be-in-my-gitignore-for-an-android-studio-project) and a [great tool](https://www.gitignore.io/)!
- [Inspect your code](https://developer.android.com/studio/write/lint.html#manuallyRunInspections)! You will find some issues that you can easily fix and make your project better!
- Discover and use new [libraries](https://github.com/codepath/android_guides/wiki/Must-Have-Libraries)!
If you have any question, don't hesitate using the [Discussion Forum](https://discussions.udacity.com/) or set up a [1:1 appointment](https://calendly.com/and-1-1)
 
 
I hope you like this review and that your Nanodegree can be fun and rewarding to you! :blush:
 
Stay :udacious:

rubric.description:
Create an app to display recent news stories on a topic of your choice using an API.
- - - 

### Before You Submit

Be sure you follow the steps to prepare your project for submission, clean your build, review the project rubric, and zip your project files. 
- - - 
### Submitting Your Project
 
To submit your project, you will upload your zip file. 
 
On the submission page, you'll see a **Notes to reviewer** section (image below) - 
 
![image](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/edFd4IyrrwW3EEsm1yZC8M-aPtLX7f9pz9mhugFLn1RcnuRs0cK-Wrlh_FeZaFPleTKc74nvA8HdQhmaQQ=s0#w=1448&h=444)
 
In order to help project reviewers test and troubleshoot the project, please provide the devices (emulator and physical) and API level on which you tested your work. Note, providing this information does not guarantee the review will be done on the exact same device type(s); however, it will assist in providing a more efficient review experience for you as a student.
 
You can also provide any other additional notes to the reviewer in that section. 
- - - 
### What to Expect After Submitting

It can take us up to a week to grade the project, but in most cases it is much faster. You will get an email when your submission has been reviewed. 

Your reviewer will provide a code review with helpful comments and review your project against the project rubric.
